member.name: T:Litium.Plus.CMS.WebControls.Image
member.summary: The Image web control is a sub classed version of the Litium.Foundation.Modules.CMS.WebControls.Image web control with these differences: The image text of the image may be rendered as separate element before or after the image. The image and the image text may be wrapped inside a container element with an explicit width set to the width of the image.
member.example:
This example shows how to use the webcontrol.
<plus:Image Name="Image" CssClass="image" ContainerTagName="P" ContainerClass="container" ImageTextClass="imagetext" ImageTextPosition="AfterImage" ImageTextTagName="Span" MaxWidth="220" RenderContainer="True" runat="server" />

member.name: T:Litium.Plus.CMS.WebControls.DebugInfo
member.summary: Renders various information about the current page, website, currently logged in user, etc.
member.example:
This example shows how to use the webcontrol.
After implementing the example below you simply visit someurl.aspx?litiumstudiodebuginfo=anyvalue to turn debugging on. The debugging session will last until session times out or you visit someurl.aspx?litiumstudiodebuginfo=false.
<plus:DebugInfo runat="server" />
After implementing the example below the debug info will be visible for the system user without the need for using url parameter as a trigger.
<plus:DebugInfo VisibleForSystemUser="true" runat="server" />

member.name: T:Litium.Plus.CMS.WebControls.DescendantRepeater
member.summary: Lists latest published pages starting from a specified page, a list of specified pages or from the current .

remarks.para: The pages can be sorted by referencing a or a .
The list of pages is built using PageInfoCarriers to minimize performance penalty.

member.example:
This example shows how to use the webcontrol with the ChildrenPageTypeNames property set to display only NewsItems:
<plus:DescendantRepeater ChildrenPageTypeNames="NewsItem" runat="server"> <ItemTemplate> <web:ShortName runat="server" /> </ItemTemplate> </plus:DescendantRepeater>

member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.
member.returns: A equivalent to the date and time contained in , expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
does not contain a valid RFC 822 string representation of a date and time.

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.RFC822DateTime.ConvertZoneToLocalDifferential(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the time zone component of an RFC 822 date and time string representation to its local differential (time zone offset).
member.param: A string containing an RFC 822 date and time to convert.
member.returns: A date and time string that uses local differential to describe the time zone equivalent to the date and time contained in .
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.RFC822DateTime.ToString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts the value of the specified object to its equivalent string representation.
member.param: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to convert.
member.returns: A RFC 822 string representation of the value of the .
member.exception: The specified object does not represent a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.RFC822DateTime.TryParse(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in , expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), if the conversion succeeded, or MinValue if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), or does not contain a valid string representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.

member.name: P:Litium.Plus.Utilities.RFC822DateTime.Rfc822DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets the custom format specifier that may be used to represent a in the RFC 822 format.
member.value: A DateTime format string that may be used to represent a in the RFC 822 format.

remarks.para: This method returns a string representation of a that utilizes the time zone offset (local differential) to represent the offset from Greenwich mean time in hours and minutes. The is a valid date-time format string for use in the method.

The RFC 822 Date and Time specification specifies that the year will be represented as a two-digit value, but the RSS Profile recommends that all date-time values should use a four-digit year. The class follows the RSS Profile recommendation when converting a to the equivalent RFC 822 string representation.

member.name: P:Litium.Plus.Utilities.RFC822DateTime.Rfc822DateTimePatterns
member.summary: Gets an array of the expected formats for RFC 822 date-time string representations.
member.value: An array of the expected formats for RFC 822 date-time string representations that may used in the method.
member.remarks: The array of the expected formats that is returned assumes that the RFC 822 time zone is represented as or converted to a local differential representation.

member.summary: Private member to hold the DateTime format string for representing a DateTime in the RFC 3339 format.

member.summary: Private member to hold array of formats that RFC 3339 date-time representations conform to.

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.Rfc3339DateTime.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.
member.returns: A equivalent to the date and time contained in .
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
does not contain a valid RFC 3339 string representation of a date and time.

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.Rfc3339DateTime.ToString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts the value of the specified object to its equivalent string representation.
member.param: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to convert.
member.returns: A RFC 3339 string representation of the value of the .

remarks.para: This method returns a string representation of the that is precise to the three most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the milliseconds in a date and time value.

While it is possible to display higher precision fractions of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful. The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock. On Windows NT 3.5 and later, and Windows Vista operating systems, the clock's resolution is approximately 10-15 milliseconds.

member.exception: The specified object does not represent a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.name: M:Litium.Plus.Utilities.Rfc3339DateTime.TryParse(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or MinValue if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), or does not contain a valid string representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.

member.name: P:Litium.Plus.Utilities.Rfc3339DateTime.Rfc3339DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets the custom format specifier that may be used to represent a in the RFC 3339 format.
member.value: A DateTime format string that may be used to represent a in the RFC 3339 format.

remarks.para: This method returns a string representation of a that is precise to the three most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the milliseconds in a date and time value. The is a valid date-time format string for use in the method.

member.name: P:Litium.Plus.Utilities.Rfc3339DateTime.Rfc3339DateTimePatterns
member.summary: Gets an array of the expected formats for RFC 3339 date-time string representations.
member.value: An array of the expected formats for RFC 3339 date-time string representations that may used in the method.
